content.question: Consider the infinite series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The integral test can be used to verify convergence of the series because <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive, continuous, and decreasing for <math alttext="x greater than or equal to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following inequalities is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 plus, the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, is less than, the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n squared, end fraction, which is less than, the integral from 2 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo><</mo><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo><</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 2 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, is less than, the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n squared, end fraction, which is less than, 1 plus the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo><</mo><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo><</mo></mrow></mstyle><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n squared, end fraction, is less than, the integral from 2 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, d x, which is less than, 1 plus the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo><</mo><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 2 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, is less than, 1 plus the integral from 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x squared, end fraction, d x, which is less than, the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
